meanings.sent1: Tom felt hosed when his friend tricked him into trading his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The scammer hosed many people by promising fake prizes.
meanings.sent3: The magician hosed the audience by making the coin disappear and never return.
meanings.sent4: The con artist hosed the old lady out of her life savings.
meanings.sent5: The sneaky fox hosed the rabbit by pretending to be its friend.

meanings.definition: To be in a difficult or hopeless situation.
meanings.sent1: After missing the last bus, Sarah was hosed and had to walk home in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The team was hosed when their best player got injured right before the championship game.
meanings.sent3: Bob felt hosed when he realized he forgot his wallet at home while at the store.
meanings.sent4: Being lost in the forest without a map left them feeling completely hosed.
meanings.sent5: The students were hosed with a surprise test on a chapter they hadn't studied.

meanings.definition: To spray or soak with water.
meanings.sent1: The kids hosed each other during the water fight in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The gardener hosed the plants to keep them hydrated during the hot summer.
meanings.sent3: The prankster hosed his friend by turning on the hose while he was washing the car.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter hosed down the burning building to extinguish the flames.
meanings.sent5: The car wash attendant hosed the vehicles to remove the dirt and grime.
